definitions.definition: In bookkeeping, an entry in the left hand column of an account.
definitions.example: A cash sale is recorded as debit on the cash account and as credit on the sales account.

definitions.definition: A sum of money taken out of a bank account. Thus called, because in bank's bookkeeping a cash withdrawal diminishes the amount of money held on the account, i.e. bank's debt to the customer.
To make an entry on the debit side of an account.
To record a receivable in the bookkeeping.
definitions.example: We shall debit the amount of your purchase to your account.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to process of taking money from an account
Of or relating to the debit card function of a debit card rather than its often available credit card function
